    • RETURN_ERROR_FOR_FAILURE_IN_CANCELLED_FRAGMENTS

      public static final String RETURN_ERROR_FOR_FAILURE_IN_CANCELLED_FRAGMENTS
      Currently if a query is cancelled, but one of the fragments reports the status as FAILED instead of CANCELLED or FINISHED we report the query result as CANCELLED by swallowing the failures occurred in fragments. This BOOT setting allows the user to see the query status as failure. Useful for developers/testers.
      See Also:

    • MAX_QUERY_MEMORY_PER_NODE_KEY

      public static final String MAX_QUERY_MEMORY_PER_NODE_KEY
      Maximum query memory per node (in MB). Re-plan with cheaper operators if memory estimation exceeds this limit.

      DEFAULT: 2048 MB

      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • MAX_QUERY_MEMORY_PER_NODE

      public static final TypeValidators.LongValidator MAX_QUERY_MEMORY_PER_NODE

    • PERCENT_MEMORY_PER_QUERY_KEY

      public static String PERCENT_MEMORY_PER_QUERY_KEY
      Alternative way to compute per-query-per-node memory as a percent of the total available system memory.

      Suggestion for computation.

      • Assume an allowance for non-managed operators. Default assumption: 50%
      • Assume a desired number of concurrent queries. Default assumption: 10.
      • The value of this parameter is
        (1 - non-managed allowance) / concurrency
      Doing the math produces the default 5% number. The actual number given is no less than the max_query_memory_per_node amount.

      This number is used only when throttling is disabled. Setting the number to 0 effectively disables this technique as it will always produce values lower than max_query_memory_per_node.

      DEFAULT: 5%

    • PERCENT_MEMORY_PER_QUERY

      public static TypeValidators.DoubleValidator PERCENT_MEMORY_PER_QUERY

      @Deprecated public static final String ENABLE_BULK_LOAD_TABLE_LIST_KEY
      Deprecated.
      option. It will not take any effect. The option added as part of DRILL-4577, was used to mark that hive tables should be loaded for all table names at once. Then as part of DRILL-4826 was added option to regulate bulk size, because big amount of views was causing performance degradation. After last improvements for DRILL-7115 both options (ENABLE_BULK_LOAD_TABLE_LIST_KEY and BULK_LOAD_TABLE_LIST_BULK_SIZE_KEY) became obsolete and may be removed in future releases.

      • Constant Field Values

    • GRACE_PERIOD

      public static final String GRACE_PERIOD
      Boot-time config option provided to modify duration of the grace period. Grace period is the amount of time where the drillbit accepts work after the shutdown request is triggered. The primary use of grace period is to avoid the race conditions caused by zookeeper delay in updating the state information of the drillbit that is shutting down. So, it is advisable to have a grace period that is at least twice the amount of zookeeper refresh time.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

      Option whose value is a long value representing the number of bits required for computing ndv (using HLL). Controls the trade-off between accuracy and memory requirements. The number of bits correlates positively with accuracy
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • HLL_ACCURACY_VALIDATOR

      public static final TypeValidators.LongValidator HLL_ACCURACY_VALIDATOR

    • DETERMINISTIC_SAMPLING

      public static final String DETERMINISTIC_SAMPLING
      Option whose value is a boolean value representing whether to perform deterministic sampling. It translates to using the same (pre-defined) seed for the underlying pseudo-random number generator.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • DETERMINISTIC_SAMPLING_VALIDATOR

      public static final TypeValidators.BooleanValidator DETERMINISTIC_SAMPLING_VALIDATOR

    • NDV_BLOOM_FILTER_ELEMENTS

      public static final String NDV_BLOOM_FILTER_ELEMENTS
      Option whose value is a long value representing the expected number of elements in the bloom filter. The bloom filter computes the number of duplicates which is used for extrapolating the NDV when using sampling. Controls the trade-off between accuracy and memory requirements. The number of elements correlates positively with accuracy.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • NDV_BLOOM_FILTER_ELEMENTS_VALIDATOR

      public static final TypeValidators.LongValidator NDV_BLOOM_FILTER_ELEMENTS_VALIDATOR

    • NDV_BLOOM_FILTER_FPOS_PROB

      public static final String NDV_BLOOM_FILTER_FPOS_PROB
      Option whose value is a double value representing the desired max false positive probability in the bloom filter. The bloom filter computes the number of duplicates which is used for extrapolating the NDV when using sampling. Controls the trade-off between accuracy and memory requirements. The probability correlates negatively with the accuracy.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • NDV_BLOOM_FILTER_FPOS_PROB_VALIDATOR

      public static final TypeValidators.LongValidator NDV_BLOOM_FILTER_FPOS_PROB_VALIDATOR

    • TDIGEST_COMPRESSION

      public static final String TDIGEST_COMPRESSION
      Controls the 'compression' factor for the TDigest algorithm.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • TDIGEST_COMPRESSION_VALIDATOR

      public static final TypeValidators.LongValidator TDIGEST_COMPRESSION_VALIDATOR

    • METASTORE_METADATA_STORE_DEPTH_LEVEL

      public static final String METASTORE_METADATA_STORE_DEPTH_LEVEL
      Option for specifying maximum level depth for collecting metadata which will be stored in the Drill Metastore. For example, when FILE level value is set, ROW_GROUP level metadata won't be collected and stored into the Metastore.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • METASTORE_METADATA_STORE_DEPTH_LEVEL_VALIDATOR
